info.author: Ran Liu ranliu@andrew.cmu.edu
info.abstract: The Individualized Additive Factor Model (iAFM) performs a logistic regression over the "error rate" learning curve data. In addition to slope per KC, you also get slope per student. To make glmer runs fast and efficiently, we apply glmerControl with optimx as optimizer
info.description: AFM is a generalization of the log-linear test model (LLTM). It is a specific instance of logistic regression, with student-success (0 or 1) as the dependent variable and with independent variable terms for the student, the KC, and the KC by opportunity interaction. Without the third term (KC by opportunity), AFM is LLTM. If the KC Model is the Unique-Step model (and there is no third term), the model is Item Response Theory, or the Rasch model.
info.options:
Model - the column containing the Knowledge Component Model (KCM) data. Multiskill Model isn't allowed.
First Attempt - the column containing the First Attempt data
Opportunity - the column containing the Opportunity data. Has to be numeric.
Student - the column containing the Student ID.
Use Reverse Opportunity - Opportunity is max opportunity minus opportunity.
Student - Parameters Output Format, XML or Tab-delimited
